item.title: Creative Science Fair Ideas. ASAP
item.dc:creator: @jcs_double jcs_double
item.description:
@jcs_double wrote:

Touch Explosives by the Jolly Roger

This is sort of a mild explosive, but it can be quite dangerous in
large quantities. To make touch explosive (such as that found in a
snap-n-pop, but more powerful), use this recipe:

  • Mix iodine crystals into ammonia until the iodine crystals will
    not dissolve into the ammonia anymore. Pour off the excess ammonia
    and dry out the crystals on a baking sheet the same way as you
    dried the thermite (in other words, just let it sit overnight!).

  • Be careful now because these crystals are now your touch
    explosive. Carefully wrap a bunch in paper (I mean carefully!
    Friction sets 'em off!) and throw them around… pretty loud, huh?
    They are fun to put on someone’s chair. Add a small fish sinker to
    them and they can be thrown a long distance (good for crowds,
    football games, concerts, etc.) Have fun! -Jolly Roger-

try that.
im doing that for my next science project

Read full topic

item.title: Creative Science Fair Ideas. ASAP
item.dc:creator: @Pyro Pyro
item.description:
@Pyro wrote:

God all i did for my science fair was first year i did which design of paper dart flies the furthest and why. And then second year i did does handspan relate to footspan and height and vice versa etc. Im lazy though so it took me a day to do them. I know of one from our school that did well was like the insides of old music tapes. Pull the stringy crap out and stick them on tooth picks. Then get a big pices of cardboard with a makeshift yaught in the middle. Then put the toothpicks all over the bopard about 7-10cm apart like in a grid. Then you use a fan and blow wind at like low level NOT from above. And the tape shit should move. But you can see how the sails from the yaught react with the wind because of the way the tape shit blows etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Creative Science Fair Ideas. ASAP
item.dc:creator: @Rahmafett Rahmafett
item.description:
@Rahmafett wrote:

[quote=“anon95490785, post:2, topic:15063”]Hmm…

You could build yourself a hydroponics system(google it) to see if a plant would grow better in water or if it grows better in soil. I’d reccommend using cucumbers(sometimes they are grown hydroponically), or if you live in Holland then use marijuana

I was thinking about doing that a few years ago in grade 9, but instead I made some stupid little electricity game because I didn’t have enough time.[/quote]

Sadly, I don’t live in Holland. I came up with a few more bullshit ideas like,

‘Does the original color of an ingredient in a processed food give any indication of its nutritional value?’
‘Which chemicals in processed foods make the best cleaners?’
‘How do atmospheric conditions affect usage of electricity in a lightbulb?’
‘Which specific chemicals in foods make the food conduct electricity?’

Read full topic

item.title: Creative Science Fair Ideas. ASAP
item.dc:creator: @Rahmafett Rahmafett
item.description:
@Rahmafett wrote:

This is supposed to be GT high school.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 17, 2006, 05:17:08 PM[/size][hr][quote=“anon95490785, post:1, topic:15063”]…What grade are you in?

I mean, if this is rgade 6 then you can probably get away with making a lightbulb light up from orange juice, but if this is college or something then we need to know.[/quote]

I changed it a little to bring this to a high school level. Thanks.
